Coverage includes a selection of Web components such as mark-up and scripting languages, and server components of Web applications. Introduces Web programming using pair or small team programming activities.

Subject: INFO
Title: Systems Analysis I
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="200" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Study of the principles, practices and tools of information systems analysis and design. Emphasis on learning pragmatic aspects of working as a systems analyst and employing the tools of systems analysis and design.

Subject: INFO
Title: Database Management Systems
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="210" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Focuses on how to design databases for given problems, and how to use database systems effectively. Topics include database design techniques using the entity-relationship approach, techniques of translating the entity-relationship diagram into a relational schema, relational algebra, commercial query languages, and normalization techniques.

Subject: INFO
Title: Information Visualization
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="250" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Introduces the foundation and the state of the art of information visualization. Explores and reflects on the design, application, and evaluation of a diverse range of information systems. Demonstrates how a number of common types of information can be visually, intuitively and interactively represented. Provides a first-hand experience of visualizing a variety of realistic data types.

Subject: INFO
Title: Human-Centered Design Process & Methods
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="310" dept="INFO" sect="002" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Introduces the student to the process of human-centered design of interactive user interfaces. Teaches some of the basic approaches to design and evaluation of interactive user interfaces. Delivers practical advice on interaction design challenges. Applies human-centered design principles in the design of the user interface to an interactive computer system.

Subject: INFO
Title: Database Administration I
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="365" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Database Administration is a continuation of Database Management Systems, and includes the following: advanced ERD techniques, database management system internals and advanced elements of the SQL language, as well as stored procedures and triggers, specifically as demonstrated in the Oracle implementation.

Subject: INFO
Title: Information Technology Infrastructure
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="410" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Presents methods for evaluating and selecting information technologies and planning technology implementation. Emphasizes consideration of needs and issues of the organization and individuals served by the technology. Also addresses issues in management of served by the technology. Also addresses issues in management of technology after initial installation including service planning, maintenance, and evolution.

Subject: INFO
Title: Software Project Management
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="420" dept="INFO" sect="901" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: The objective of this course is to study project management in the context of software systems development. The course will cover the processes, contexts, metrics, planning and management concerns of managing projects for modern software systems.

Subject: INFO
Title: Information Professions and Professionals
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="505" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Surveys the social, ethical, and legal issues that affect information professionals and organizations. Addresses such topics as access to and ownership of information, intellectual freedom, and privacy. Studies the structure and components of the information professions and the evolving role of information professionals.

Subject: INFO
Title: Users, Services, & Resources
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="506" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Introduces the principles and practices of providing effective information services for a variety of user communities. Develops practical skills in meeting users¿ information needs. Focuses on current methods of providing information services and instruction in different contexts and techniques for evaluating reference sources and services.

Subject: INFO
Title: Users, Services, & Resources
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="506" dept="INFO" sect="901" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Introduces the principles and practices of providing effective information services for a variety of user communities. Develops practical skills in meeting users¿ information needs. Focuses on current methods of providing information services and instruction in different contexts and techniques for evaluating reference sources and services.

Subject: INFO
Title: Software Development
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="532" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Provides a hands-on introduction to software development.  Includes programming concepts and a series of programming exercises done by students working in pairs or in small groups.  Also covers general concepts and issues in software development to help students understand why creating high quality software is very difficult.

Subject: INFO
Title: Perspectives on Information Systems
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="540" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Examines various types of information systems and the ways in which these systems support activities of individuals and organizations. Investigates application architectures that occur commonly in information systems. Provides an overview of knowledge domains that comprise the information systems discipline.

Subject: INFO
Title: Introduction to Web Design for Information Organizations
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="552" dept="INFO" sect="901" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Introduction to creating websites that incorporate interactive web services to support users in information organizations.  Students learn to establish websites that meet usability, accessibility and intellectual property standards, via composition of text and graphic files, and use of scripts for interactive application to support community information resource needs.

Subject: INFO
Title: Data and Digital Stewardship
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="591" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Examines traditional and emerging approaches to data management, data curation, and data service across the full range of information organizations (including, libraries, archives, museums, data centers, software industries, etc.).  Introduces foundations of data infrastructures and data representation in all the activities related to care and management of digital objects over their lifecycles. Discusses methods and issues related to accessibility, security, preservation, privacy and ethics of using and managing digital records.

Subject: INFO
Title: Web Systems & Architecture
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="600" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: This course presents the fundamentals of data communications and software architectures for distributed computing technologies. It introduces students to key web systems technologies and architectures, including hardware configurations, HTTP, HTML, XML-based data standards and other major software components.

Subject: INFO
Title: Database Management Systems
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="605" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: A first course in database management systems. Covers database design, data manipulation, and data-base integrity. Emphasizes concepts and techniques related to the entity-relationship model and relational database systems. Discusses normalization up to third normal form and commercial query languages.

Subject: INFO
Title: Human-Computer Interaction
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="608" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Focuses on the physiological, psychological and engineering basis of design and evaluation of human-computer interfaces covering such topics as; theoretical foundation of HCI; cognitive modeling of user interactions; task analysis techniques for gathering design information; iterative design cycles; formative and summative usability testing; and project planning and report writing.

Subject: INFO
Title: Information Systems Analysis and Design
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="620" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Offers an advanced treatment of systems analysis and design with special emphasis on object-oriented analysis and design techniques based on the Unified Modeling Language (UML). Discusses major modeling techniques of UML including use-case modeling, class modeling, object-interaction modeling, dynamic modeling and state diagrams and activity diagrams, subsystems developments, logical design, and physical design.

Subject: INFO
Title: Data Mining
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="634" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: This course introduces the concepts and principles of knowledge discovery in databases (KDD), with a focus on the techniques of data mining and its function in business, governmental, medical or other information-intensive environments.

Subject: INFO
Title: Information Systems Management
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="646" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Addresses information technology-enabled change and policy issues in the management of information systems (IS). Stresses systems development, staffing and organization, technology infrastructure, project selection, justification and funding, and data. Studies the issues and their resolution in the context of an IS plan. Emphasizes communication about the issues to senior management.

Subject: INFO
Title: Library Programming
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="649" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Provides an overview of the broad range of cultural, educational, and social library programming initiatives available for children, adolescents, and adults in academic libraries, public libraries, and school library media centers. Teaches community analysis, planning and evaluation. Emphasizes the collaborative nature of developing and implementing library programs.

Subject: INFO
Title: Introduction to Data Analytics
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="659" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Provides an overview of data analytics foundations and techniques for information professionals. Introduces fundamental concepts and theories of data and data science. Discusses methods and techniques of data representation, data analysis, and data visualization. Covers a range of tools and systems that can be used to discover insight and derive values from data.

Subject: INFO
Title: Resources for Young Adults
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="684" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Acquaints prospective professionals with the materials intended for use by and with young adults. Provides an opportunity to develop basic standards for evaluation of materials and to learn about recent research concerning young adults and their information needs, reading interests, tastes, and development.

Subject: INFO
Title: Research Statistics I
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="812" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: This course provides the knowledge and tools necessary for conducting and understanding many types of empirical studies in the field of information science.  It examines the fundamentals of descriptive and inferential statistics, and hypothesis testing.  It covers analysis of variance and introduces regression.  Students gain practical experience with a statistical package such as SPSS.

Subject: INFO
Title: Capstone Project
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="890" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: The capstone course is intended as a culminating experience to bring together all that students have learned in their degree programs and to enable them to apply what they have learned to work or research in their intended professional fields. Projects will be individualized to enable students to design work closely aligned with their own learning and professional goals.

Subject: INFO
Title: Introduction to Computing and Security Technology
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="INFO" sect="003" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Introduces the basic knowledge and techniques required to use computing effectively in organizations. Explores information systems, information technology and software concepts with an emphasis on how computing can be used to help organizations meet their goals.

Subject: INFO
Title: Introduction to Computing and Security Technology
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="INFO" sect="005" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Explores the infrastructure that makes current information and communication technology possible. Introduces foundational concepts of servers, networks, databases, and the Web. Addresses security and usability considerations that cut across all computing technology. Approaches computing technology from the perspective of system administrators who plan, manage, operate, and monitor large scale computing infrastructure. Covers emerging technologies including pervasive computing, continuous integration, virtualization, and the Internet of things. Explores professional opportunities in this high demand area.

Subject: INFO
Title: Introduction to Computing and Security Technology
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="INFO" sect="902" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Introduces the basic knowledge and techniques required to use computing effectively in organizations. Explores information systems, information technology and software concepts with an emphasis on how computing can be used to help organizations meet their goals.

Subject: INFO
Title: Introduction to Human-Computer Interaction
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="110" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Introduces the field of human-computer interaction, with a broad scope that exposes students to a variety of approaches for conceptualizing, designing, and evaluating user interfaces and user experiences. Focuses on using design thinking to define problems and solutions, and developing skills for critiquing interactive systems. Topics include interaction design principles, user experience research, usability evaluation, and novel interaction paradigms.

Subject: INFO
Title: Web Systems and Services I
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="151" dept="INFO" sect="002" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Introduces technologies used to build leading-edge application systems and services on the World Wide Web. Coverage includes a selection of Web components such as mark-up and scripting languages, and server components of Web applications. Introduces Web programming using pair or small team programming activities.

Subject: INFO
Title: Web Systems and Services I
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="151" dept="INFO" sect="903" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Introduces technologies used to build leading-edge application systems and services on the World Wide Web. Coverage includes a selection of Web components such as mark-up and scripting languages, and server components of Web applications. Introduces Web programming using pair or small team programming activities.

Subject: INFO
Title: Systems Analysis I
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="200" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Study of the principles, practices and tools of information systems analysis and design. Emphasis on learning pragmatic aspects of working as a systems analyst and employing the tools of systems analysis and design.

Subject: INFO
Title: Database Management Systems
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="210" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Focuses on how to design databases for given problems, and how to use database systems effectively. Topics include database design techniques using the entity-relationship approach, techniques of translating the entity-relationship diagram into a relational schema, relational algebra, commercial query languages, and normalization techniques.

Subject: INFO
Title: Human-Centered Design Process & Methods
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="310" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Introduces the student to the process of human-centered design of interactive user interfaces. Teaches some of the basic approaches to design and evaluation of interactive user interfaces. Delivers practical advice on interaction design challenges. Applies human-centered design principles in the design of the user interface to an interactive computer system.

Subject: INFO
Title: Database Administration I
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="365" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Database Administration is a continuation of Database Management Systems, and includes the following: advanced ERD techniques, database management system internals and advanced elements of the SQL language, as well as stored procedures and triggers, specifically as demonstrated in the Oracle implementation.

Subject: INFO
Title: Data Mining Applications
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="371" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Introduces students to basic data mining approaches using machine learning tools. Focuses on machine learning algorithms for information inference and knowledge discovery from data. Covers major applications in data/text/web processing, analysis and mining.

Subject: INFO
Title: Software Project Management
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="420" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: The objective of this course is to study project management in the context of software systems development. The course will cover the processes, contexts, metrics, planning and management concerns of managing projects for modern software systems.

Subject: INFO
Title: Information Professions and Professionals
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="505" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Surveys the social, ethical, and legal issues that affect information professionals and organizations. Addresses such topics as access to and ownership of information, intellectual freedom, and privacy. Studies the structure and components of the information professions and the evolving role of information professionals.

Subject: INFO
Title: Information Professions and Professionals
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="505" dept="INFO" sect="901" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Surveys the social, ethical, and legal issues that affect information professionals and organizations. Addresses such topics as access to and ownership of information, intellectual freedom, and privacy. Studies the structure and components of the information professions and the evolving role of information professionals.

Subject: INFO
Title: Users, Services, & Resources
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="506" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Introduces the principles and practices of providing effective information services for a variety of user communities. Develops practical skills in meeting users¿ information needs. Focuses on current methods of providing information services and instruction in different contexts and techniques for evaluating reference sources and services.

Subject: INFO
Title: Principles of Cybersecurity
Section_Comments: Portions of this section are reserved of CCI students & CYBR
Description: Provides the foundation for understanding the key issues associated with protecting information assets, determining the levels of protection and response to security incidents. Presents a general overview and is suitable for individuals with little exposure to IT security.

Subject: INFO
Title: Software Development
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="532" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Provides a hands-on introduction to software development. Includes programming concepts and a series of programming exercises done by students working in pairs or in small groups. Also covers general concepts and issues in software development to help students understand why creating high quality software is very difficult.

Subject: INFO
Title: Perspectives on Information Systems
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="540" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Examines various types of information systems and the ways in which these systems support activities of individuals and organizations. Investigates application architectures that occur commonly in information systems. Provides an overview of knowledge domains that comprise the information systems discipline.

Subject: INFO
Title: Introduction to Archives I
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="560" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Provides an introduction to the theory and practice of archives, including an overview relating to the elements of an archival program and the role and work of archivists.  Focuses on the functions of the archives, such as acquisition, appraisal, arrangement and description, preservation, reference, outreach, and technology in archives.

Subject: INFO
Title: Data and Digital Stewardship
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="591" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Examines traditional and emerging approaches to data management, data curation, and data service across the full range of information organizations (including, libraries, archives, museums, data centers, software industries, etc.).  Introduces foundations of data infrastructures and data representation in all the activities related to care and management of digital objects over their lifecycles. Discusses methods and issues related to accessibility, security, preservation, privacy and ethics of using and managing digital records.

Subject: INFO
Title: Web Systems & Architecture
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="600" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: This course presents the fundamentals of data communications and software architectures for distributed computing technologies. It introduces students to key web systems technologies and architectures, including hardware configurations, HTTP, HTML, XML-based data standards and other major software components.

Subject: INFO
Title: Healthcare Informatics
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="648" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: The course presents an overview of all aspects of healthcare informatics, including medical, nursing and bioinformatics. It provides an introduction to the applications of information systems in a variety of healthcare environments, including education, research and clinical settings.  It includes extensive reading and critical discussion of relevant professional research literature.

Subject: INFO
Title: Public Library Service
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="650" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Surveys information services provided through public libraries, with attention to governmental and funding issues, determinants of use, extending services to non-users, and cooperation among libraries.

Subject: INFO
Title: Introduction to Data Analytics
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="659" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Provides an overview of data analytics foundations and techniques for information professionals. Introduces fundamental concepts and theories of data and data science. Discusses methods and techniques of data representation, data analysis, and data visualization. Covers a range of tools and systems that can be used to discover insight and derive values from data.

Subject: INFO
Title: Digital Preservation
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="756" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: Explores concepts, principles, and practice for preserving digital information resources. Topics include selection, organization, and access for materials in trusted repositories. Both technological and policy perspectives are addressed.

Subject: INFO
Title: Capstone Project
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="890" dept="INFO" sect="001" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: The capstone course is intended as a culminating experience to bring together all that students have learned in their degree programs and to enable them to apply what they have learned to work or research in their intended professional fields. Projects will be individualized to enable students to design work closely aligned with their own learning and professional goals.

Subject: INFO
Title: Health Informatics Experience
Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="896" dept="INFO" sect="900" term="F18" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
Description: The Health Informatics Experience capstone is a culminating experience that enables students to apply what they have learned to address a specific problem in an approved health-related environment. It may be research or practice-related.
